meanings.definition: Show (someone) to be involved in a crime.
meanings.sent1: The evidence clearly implicated him in the robbery.
meanings.sent2: The detective implicated the suspect in the theft.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy thief implicated himself by leaving his ID at the scene.
meanings.sent4: Her fingerprints on the weapon implicated her as the culprit.
meanings.sent5: The security camera footage implicated the suspect beyond doubt.

meanings.definition: Convey (a meaning or intention) indirectly through what one says, rather than stating it explicitly.
meanings.sent1: His tone of voice implicated that he was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The teacher implicated that there would be a surprise quiz next week.
meanings.sent3: The sarcastic comment implicated more than what was actually said.
meanings.sent4: Her raised eyebrows implicated her disapproval of the plan.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room implicated tension between the two friends.
